Subject: Obscure alexa-tools (av_procarc) issue
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=172190008
X-Yahoo-Profile: andyboyko

We've seen a couple of cases here in which the alexa-tools av_procarc
DAT file maker generates a DAT incorrectly, from Heritrix ARC files.
For a small number of records in the DATs, it may fail to prefix a
blank
line before the header line for the record, causing that record to be
lost in
CDX processing, and adding its attributes to the previous record's
(leading to incorrect ARC offsets and MIME types for the previous
item).
 
As far as I can possibly see, it's not related to the format of the ARC
itself; 
Heritrix is, I think, blameless.  Rather, it may be related to the
immediately 
preceding file containing a large number of embedded images and links,

creating a larger-than-normal DAT record.  I wonder whether anyone else

using the av_procarc tool might have detected this problem?  I have yet
to 
find any particular suspicious code in av_procarc, but haven't delved
very far.
 
The following Perl lunacy indicates how to fix a DAT file so afflicted.
 
  perl -pi -e 'undef $/;
s/([^\n])\n(https?:\/\/.*alexa\/dat)/$1\n\n$2/g' *dat
 
Regards to all,
Andy Boyko    aboy@... 
Library of Congress
